private_information: Expert in translating informal action descriptions into STRIPS-like operators
Capable of inferring a coherent set of predicates and object symbols
Will not emit PDDL; will instead provide a clean intermediate action model
world_modeler.goal: Extract the action signatures, predicates, and effect semantics from public information into a normalized action model.

private_information: Specialist in parsing textual scenarios into structured facts: objects, initial states, goals, and proposed plans
Will not emit PDDL; will instead provide structured scenario data ready for modeling and auditing
scenario_analyst.goal: Parse the two scenario statements into structured sets of objects, initial facts, goals, and, where provided, a candidate plan.

private_information: Audits temporal and causal consistency of plans using STRIPS semantics
Removes bookkeeping shortcuts such as quota tokens or post-hoc penalties
Ensures add and delete effects are applied consistently and that preconditions are satisfied at each step
Will not emit PDDL; will provide verified traces, counterexamples, or minimal repairs
auditor.goal: Validate the candidate plan for Scenario A against the extracted action model and initial facts, diagnose any precondition violations, propose repairs if possible, and assess feasibility of Scenario B.

private_information: Coordinates contributions from the modeling and auditing agents
Responsible for the final PDDL artifacts only
Targets the FastDownward solver with standard STRIPS operators, using add and delete lists and no functions
orchestrator.goal: Integrate the action model and audited scenarios to produce a final PDDL domain and problem files suitable for FastDownward.

init.semantics: Classical planning with STRIPS semantics; actions have preconditions and add/delete effects over predicates cats, collect, hand, next, sneeze, spring, stupendous, texture, vase.

public_information: Actions and arities: paltry(object_0, object_1, object_2); sip(object_0, object_1, object_2); clip(object_0, object_1, object_2); wretched(object_0, object_1, object_2, object_3); memory(object_0, object_1, object_2); tightfisted(object_0, object_1, object_2).
Preconditions paltry: hand(object_0) and cats(object_1) and texture(object_2) and vase(object_0, object_1) and next(object_1, object_2).
Effects paltry add: next(object_0, object_2).
Effects paltry delete: vase(object_0, object_1).
Preconditions sip: hand(object_0) and cats(object_1) and texture(object_2) and next(object_0, object_2) and next(object_1, object_2).
Effects sip add: vase(object_0, object_1).
Effects sip delete: next(object_0, object_2).
Preconditions clip: hand(object_0) and sneeze(object_1) and texture(object_2) and next(object_1, object_2) and next(object_0, object_2).
Effects clip add: vase(object_0, object_1).
Effects clip delete: next(object_0, object_2).

Preconditions wretched: sneeze(object_0) and texture(object_1) and texture(object_2) and stupendous(object_3) and next(object_0, object_1) and collect(object_1, object_3) and collect(object_2, object_3).
Effects wretched add: next(object_0, object_2).
Effects wretched delete: next(object_0, object_1).
Preconditions memory: cats(object_0) and spring(object_1) and spring(object_2) and next(object_0, object_1).
Effects memory add: next(object_0, object_2).
Effects memory delete: next(object_0, object_1).
Preconditions tightfisted: hand(object_0) and sneeze(object_1) and texture(object_2) and next(object_1, object_2) and vase(object_0, object_1).
Effects tightfisted add: next(object_0, object_2).
Effects tightfisted delete: vase(object_0, object_1).

Scenario A initial facts: cats(object_0); collect(object_5, object_1); collect(object_6, object_1); collect(object_7, object_2); collect(object_8, object_2); hand(object_10); hand(object_9); next(object_0, object_7); next(object_10, object_5); next(object_3, object_5); next(object_4, object_8); next(object_9, object_8); sneeze(object_3); sneeze(object_4); spring(object_5); spring(object_7); stupendous(object_1); stupendous(object_2); texture(object_5); texture(object_6); texture(object_7); texture(object_8).
Scenario A goal: next(object_10, object_5) and next(object_9, object_7).
Scenario A candidate plan (for audit): clip(object_9, object_4, object_8); wretched(object_4, object_8, object_7, object_2); tightfisted(object_9, object_4, object_7).

Scenario B initial facts: cats(object_0); collect(object_5, object_1); collect(object_6, object_1); collect(object_7, object_2); collect(object_8, object_2); hand(object_10); hand(object_9); next(object_0, object_5); next(object_10, object_5); next(object_3, object_5); next(object_4, object_8); next(object_9, object_5); sneeze(object_3); sneeze(object_4); spring(object_5); spring(object_7); stupendous(object_1); stupendous(object_2); texture(object_5); texture(object_6); texture(object_7); texture(object_8).
Scenario B goal: next(object_10, object_6) and next(object_9, object_6).

Assumptions: all predicates are boolean; operators are deterministic; objects are untyped unless the PDDL domain introduces types for tooling convenience; no numeric fluents or conditional effects are required.

extract_actions.system_prompt: You are a domain modeling expert who normalizes informal action descriptions into a clean STRIPS-style action model with predicates and operator schemas. Do not emit PDDL; produce a compact, unambiguous JSON-like description.
extract_actions.prompt: From the public information, extract: 1) the full predicate list; 2) the action schemas for paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted with their parameter roles, preconditions, add effects, and delete effects; 3) the canonical object symbols. Be faithful to the given semantics and names. Output as an object with keys predicates, actions, objects. Public info: {environment->public_information}.

extract_scenarios.system_prompt: You convert text scenarios into structured data: objects, initial facts, goals, and optional plans. Do not emit PDDL; provide normalized symbol lists and facts.
extract_scenarios.prompt: Parse the two scenarios in the public information into a structured object with keys: scenario_A {objects, init, goal, candidate_plan}, scenario_B {objects, init, goal}. Ensure all atoms use the exact predicate and object symbols as written. Public info: {environment->public_information}.

audit.system_prompt: You audit temporal and causal consistency of candidate plans using STRIPS semantics, removing bookkeeping shortcuts and post-hoc penalties. You do not emit PDDL. You return verified traces, violations with justifications, and minimal repairs if they exist.
audit.prompt: Using the provided action model and scenarios, perform: 1) Step-by-step simulation of Scenario A's candidate plan, checking each action's preconditions and applying add/delete effects; 2) Identify any unmet preconditions or missing supporting facts, and either validate the plan or provide a minimal repaired plan; 3) For Scenario B, provide observations about which subgoals require which operators and whether the goal is reachable from the given facts, highlighting necessary supporting conditions such as vase or next links. Return a JSON-like object with keys: scenario_A {status: VALID or INVALID, trace, issues, repaired_plan}, scenario_B {feasibility_notes, suggested_strategy}. Inputs: {actions_spec} and {scenarios}.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-scenario PDDL authoring for the FastDownward planner. Produce a final PDDL domain and problem files targeting STRIPS. Use lowercase names for predicates and actions. Include :requirements at least :strips and optionally :typing. Represent deletes via explicit negative effects (delete list). Do not invent extraneous functions or costs. Always enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> and each PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: Integrate the action model and audit to synthesize a correct PDDL domain and problem files for FastDownward. Domain: define predicates {actions_spec->predicates} and operators paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted with the exact preconditions and effects as modeled. Objects: include all symbols used in both scenarios, preserving names. Problems: provide two problems, one for Scenario A and one for Scenario B. For Scenario A, if the audited plan was repaired, ensure the initial state reflects the scenario facts and the goal is next(object_10, object_5) and next(object_9, object_7). For Scenario B, use the given initial facts and goal next(object_10, object_6) and next(object_9, object_6). Ensure each problem's :init enumerates all true atoms from its scenario and omits those not stated. Target FastDownward defaults (e.g., seq-sat-lama-2011). Inputs to integrate: action model {actions_spec}, scenarios {scenarios}, audit findings {audited_findings}. Output the final domain and both problems with tags: <domain>...</domain><problem>...Scenario A...</problem><problem>...Scenario B...</problem>.
